page.title: 06Alyn Valley Wildlife (2)
page.content: The importance of the Alyn valley woodlands for wildlife has led to this particular locality along the river being designated a 'Site of Special Scientific Interest' The woods, old mines and buildings provide roosting sites for bats. Lately many disused mine-shafts in the area have been sealed in the interests of safety, but there has been concern that this may in some cases have pre- vented bats,now protected by law, from using roosting sites in old mines. The newly formed Clwyd Bat Group is hoping to give greater protection to known bat roosts in the area. Another conservation issue of concern is the digging of badger setts, for 'badger-baiting' with dogs. Local members of the Clwyd Badger Group are helping to prevent the disturbance of occupied setts.
